definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw

sentences.english: Seems Charlie's in hot water…And she's about to get burned.
sentences.chinese: 查莉貌似陷入水深火熱，馬上要引火上身了。

sentences.english: It really is the simplest way, to keep from getting burned.
sentences.chinese: 這的確是簡單的辦法，來防止引火上身。

sentences.english: I was a block of wood, I became a firebrand .
sentences.chinese: 我從前是塊木頭，後來成了引火的乾柴。

sentences.english: It really is the simplest way to keep from getting burned.
sentences.chinese: 這是避免引火上身最簡單的方法。

sentences.english: So, you know, they’ve kind of dallied in the mainstream and I think they got burned.
sentences.chinese: 過於非主流使得他們有點引火焚身了。

sentences.english: It really the simplest way to keep from getting burned.
sentences.chinese: 這的確是簡單的辦法，來防止引火上身。

sentences.english: Or it is like holding onto hot coals, but you're the one getting burned.
sentences.chinese: 或許這就像手持熱炭，你卻引火燒身。

sentences.english: We can insert a short length of magnesium ribbon into the ignition charge to act as a fuse.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以插一短截鎂條於引火劑中作引線。

sentences.english: He then lit himself and became a fireball.
sentences.chinese: 接着他就引火自焚變成火球。

sentences.english: It is added that he said he used his shirt as firing material.
sentences.chinese: 據其聲稱，他的引火物是自己的襯衣。

sentences.english: You put best into it , the careful ignition immolated oneself.
sentences.chinese: 你好自爲子吧，小心引火自焚了。

sentences.english: Anything sort of that we're going to burn you 11)at the stake"?"
sentences.chinese: 任何此類行爲將會是引火燒身”？

sentences.english: Venture capitalists are right to warn entrepreneurs of getting caught with their pants singed.
sentences.chinese: 風投資本家警告創業者勿“引火燒身”，這是對的。

sentences.english: They could see the smoke of the burning lint-stock.
sentences.chinese: 人們看到點燃了的引火線在冒煙。

sentences.english: Object To observe the application of Yinhuo Guiyuan Tang for burning mouth syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察應用自擬引火歸元湯治療灼口綜合徵的療效。

sentences.english: The girl touched a lighted match to the kindling.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩用擦着的火柴點引火物。

definition: to make a fire/to light a fire
to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
to light a fire for cooking
